flawed_nl_solution:
The discount is 45*0.2=$<<45*0.2=9>>9 off each pair
So she pays 45-9= $<<45-9=63>>63 each
So it will cost 63*10=$<<63*10=630>>630 before tax
The tax will add 630*0.1=$<<630*0.1=63>>63
So she has to pay 630+63=$<<630+63=693>>693
#### 693

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36, not 63. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
